greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Product_{ p | n } (1 + Legendre(2,p) ).
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: Multiplicative with a(2^e)=1, a(p^e)=0 if p mod 8=3 or p mod 8=5 and a(p^e)=2 if p mod 8=1 or p mod 8=7. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Mar 02 2004
maple: with(numtheory); L := proc(n,N) local i,t1,t2; t1 := ifactors(n)[2]; t2 := mul((1+legendre(N,t1[i][1])),i=1..nops(t1)); end; [seq(L(n,2),n=1..120)];
mathematica: a[n_] := If[n == 1, 1, Product[1 + KroneckerSymbol[2, p], {p, FactorInteger[n][[All, 1]]}]];
program: (PARI) a(n)={my(f=factor(n)[,1]); prod(i=1, #f, 1 + kronecker(2, f[i]))} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 23 2018
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 02 2004
